alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hancock, southwestern McDonough, southwestern Lee and Clark Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 230 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Warsaw, or near Keokuk, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... West Point around 250 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bowen and Augusta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
